definition: to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)

sentences.english: Standard linings are supplied in either 2oz or 4oz machine washable FR polyester.
sentences.chinese: 提供标准的内胆是在任一盎司或阻燃聚酯安士机洗。

sentences.english: The company expects to produce 4.5 million ounces this year.
sentences.chinese: 安格鲁黄金公司今年有望生产450万盎司黄金。

sentences.english: The hot and cold dispense quantities can be selected in one-half ounce increments up to 8 ounces.
sentences.chinese: 热和冷的分配量可以选择增加半盎司到8盎司。

sentences.english: The hot and cold dispense quantities can be selected in one-half ounce increments up to 8 ounces.
sentences.chinese: 热和冷的分配量可以选择增加半盎司到8盎司。

sentences.english: USDA guidelines recommend three ounces or more of whole grains per day.
sentences.chinese: USDA指南中建议每天使用三盎司以上全谷类食品。

sentences.english: Two 40s is the equivalent of, what, six beers?
sentences.chinese: 两只手40盎司，相当于，额，六支啤酒？

sentences.english: She’s the size of a lime and weighs about an ounce.
sentences.chinese: 她差不多酸橙大小，重约一盎司。

sentences.english: Together, the phone and probe weigh about 13 ounces.
sentences.chinese: 智能手机和探头总共重量约为13盎司左右。

sentences.english: An ounce of practice is worth a pound of percept.
sentences.chinese: 一盎司的幸运胜过一磅的智慧。

sentences.english: Float 1oz Captain Morgan Spiced Rum on top.
sentences.chinese: 在顶部漂浮1盎司五香摩根船长朗姆酒。

sentences.english: Currently, the U. S. "officially" has 261 Million ounces of gold.
sentences.chinese: 目前，美国“官方”拥有261百万盎司黄金。

sentences.english: At that time gold was worth $920 an ounce.
sentences.chinese: 那时候，黄金的价值为每盎司920美元。

sentences.english: Wednesday, the price of gold topped $1,505 an ounce.
sentences.chinese: 星期三，黄金价格涨到每盎司1505美元。

sentences.english: Add 1 ounce Brandy-Cranberry Syrup and mix.
sentences.chinese: 加入1盎司白兰地蔓越莓汁，混合。

sentences.english: Schedule certain times of the day to chug back 8 ounces at once.
sentences.chinese: 附表一定的时间，每天突突回到8盎司一次。

definition: to receive mail/to receive a telegraph
NASDAQ/National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations, a computerized data system to provide brokers with price quotations for securities traded over the counter
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
Dow Jones Industrial Average (abbr. for 道瓊斯指數|道琼斯指数[Dao4 Qiong2 si1 Zhi3 shu4])
in a few days/one of these days
to regurgitate/(fig.) (of a stock market) to give up (gains)
